words.title: Leaving/Quitting/Exiting emacs
words.usage:
C-x C-c - exit emacs 
C-z - suspend emacs in the terminal (iconify emacs)

words.title: Buffer
words.meaning:
A buffer is an area of memory used to store the text of a file being edited. 
When you open a file in Emacs, a buffer is created to hold the contents of the file.
words.usage: C-x b - allows you to switch between buffer and displays a list of all open buffers, also allowing you to select the one to switch to.

words.title: Cut
words.usage:
# C-w - to cut a file.
# C-a C-k - to cut an entire line.

words.title: Quit and Save
words.meaning: This will save all unsaved changes and then quit the program.
words.usage: M-x save-buffers-kill-emacs

words.usage: C-x C-f
